title: Chrome SidePanel API MV3 Requirement
details:
CRITICAL FINDING: Chrome DOES have a sidebar API called chrome.sidePanel, but it REQUIRES Manifest V3.

Current Extension Status:
- Firefox manifest.json: Manifest V2 with sidebar_action
- Chrome manifest.chrome.json: Manifest V2 with default_popup

Chrome sidePanel API Details:
- API Name: chrome.sidePanel (NOT sidebarAction)
- Manifest Key: "side_panel" (NOT "sidebar_action")
- Manifest Version: REQUIRES Manifest V3 (released May 2023)
- Permission: "sidePanel"

Key Differences from Firefox:
- Firefox uses browser.sidebarAction in MV2
- Chrome uses chrome.sidePanel in MV3 only
- API methods are similar but incompatible
- Chrome: side_panel manifest key
- Firefox: sidebar_action manifest key

Implementation Options:
1. Create separate manifest.chrome.v3.json with sidePanel support
2. Migrate entire extension to Manifest V3 for both browsers
3. Keep current approach (Chrome popup, Firefox sidebar)

Code Example for Chrome MV3:
```json
{
  "manifest_version": 3,
  "side_panel": {
    "default_path": "sidebar/settings.html"
  },
  "permissions": ["sidePanel"]
}
```

```javascript
// Open side panel on action click
chrome.sidePanel.setPanelBehavior({ openPanelOnActionClick: true });

// Programmatically open
chrome.sidePanel.open({ windowId: tab.windowId });
```

Documentation Sources:
- Chrome Developers: developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/api/sidePanel
- Released: May 2023
- Requires: Chrome 114+ with MV3
